alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette and Dickinson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Chassell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lower portions of Sturgeon River Road... Aho Road...and Rajala Road are impassable At 14.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge between Sturgeon River Road and Rajala Road. The bridge begins to cause backwater effects at this stage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 245 AM CDT /345 AM EDT/.
